Imported Translations from Zanata

For more information about this automatic import see:
https://docs.openstack.org/i18n/latest/reviewing-translation-import.html

Change-Id: Ie586f428fd86f1a6acd00271f8e8fb07f7eb7316
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/27/848527/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2022-06-27 16:44+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2022-07-02 10:12+0000\n""A comparable group, ``.reseller_reader``, is now available for development " "purposes when authenticating using tempauth." msgstr "" "A comparable group, ``.reseller_reader``, is now available for development " "purposes when authenticating using tempauth." msgid ""msgid "" "A new ``item_size_warning_threshold`` option may be used to monitor for " "values that are approaching the limit of what can be stored in memcache. See " "the memcache sample config for more information." msgstr "" "A new ``item_size_warning_threshold`` option may be used to monitor for " "values that are approaching the limit of what can be stored in memcache. See " "the memcache sample config for more information." msgid "Add root containers with compactible ranges to recon cache." msgstr "Add root containers with compatible ranges to recon cache." "Added \"audit watcher\" hooks to allow operators to run arbitrary code " "against every diskfile in a cluster. For more information, see `the " "documentation <https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/development_watchers." "html>`__." msgstr "" "Added \"audit watcher\" hooks to allow operators to run arbitrary code " "against every diskfile in a cluster. For more information, see `the " "documentation <https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/development_watchers." "html>`__." msgid ""msgid "Added ``tasks_per_second`` option to rate-limit the object-expirer." msgstr "Added ``tasks_per_second`` option to rate-limit the object-expirer." "Added ``usedforsecurity`` annotations for use on FIPS-compliant systems." msgstr "" "Added ``usedforsecurity`` annotations for use on FIPS-compliant systems." msgid ""msgid "Added a ``--dry-run`` option for the 'compact' command." msgstr "Added a ``--dry-run`` option for the 'compact' command." msgid "" "Added a ``--includes`` option for the 'show' command to only output shard " "ranges that may include a given object name." msgstr "" "Added a ``--includes`` option for the 'show' command to only output shard " "ranges that may include a given object name." msgid "" "Added a delay before deleting non-durable data. A new configuration option, " "``commit_window`` in the ``[DEFAULT]`` section of object-server.conf, " "adjusts this delay; the default is 60 seconds. This improves the durability " "of both back-dated PUTs (from the reconciler or container-sync, for example) " "and fresh writes to handoffs by preventing the reconstructor from deleting " "data that the object-server was still writing." msgstr "" "Added a delay before deleting non-durable data. A new configuration option, " "``commit_window`` in the ``[DEFAULT]`` section of object-server.conf, " "adjusts this delay; the default is 60 seconds. This improves the durability " "of both back-dated PUTs (from the reconciler or container-sync, for example) " "and fresh writes to handoffs by preventing the reconstructor from deleting " "data that the object-server was still writing." "Added a new 'analyze' command to automatically identify overlapping shard " "ranges and recommend a resolution based on a JSON listing of shard ranges " "such as produced by the 'show' command." msgstr "" "Added a new 'analyze' command to automatically identify overlapping shard " "ranges and recommend a resolution based on a JSON listing of shard ranges " "such as produced by the 'show' command." msgid "" "Added a new 'repair' command to automatically identify and optionally " "resolve overlapping shard ranges." msgstr "" "Added a new 'repair' command to automatically identify and optionally " "resolve overlapping shard ranges." msgid "" "Added a new ``swift.common.registry`` module. This includes helper functions " "``register_sensitive_header`` and ``register_sensitive_param`` which third " "party middleware authors may use to flag headers and query parameters for " "redaction when logging. For more information, see `the documentation " "<https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/misc.html# module-swift.common." "registry>`__." msgstr "" "Added a new ``swift.common.registry`` module. This includes helper functions " "``register_sensitive_header`` and ``register_sensitive_param`` which third " "party middleware authors may use to flag headers and query parameters for " "redaction when logging. For more information, see `the documentation " "<https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/misc.html# module-swift.common." "registry>`__." msgid "" "Added a new config option, ``minimum_shard_size``. When scanning for shard " "ranges, if the final shard would otherwise contain fewer than this many " "objects, the previous shard will instead be expanded to the end of the " "namespace (and so may contain up to ``rows_per_shard + minimum_shard_size`` " "objects). This reduces the number of small shards generated. The default " "value is ``rows_per_shard / 5``." msgstr "" "Added a new config option, ``minimum_shard_size``. When scanning for shard " "ranges, if the final shard would otherwise contain fewer than this many " "objects, the previous shard will instead be expanded to the end of the " "namespace (and so may contain up to ``rows_per_shard + minimum_shard_size`` " "objects). This reduces the number of small shards generated. The default " "value is ``rows_per_shard / 5``." msgid "" "Added a new config option, ``rows_per_shard``, to specify how many objects " "should be in each shard when scanning for ranges. The default is " "``shard_container_threshold / 2``, preserving existing behavior." msgstr "" "Added a new config option, ``rows_per_shard``, to specify how many objects " "should be in each shard when scanning for ranges. The default is " "``shard_container_threshold / 2``, preserving existing behaviour." msgid "" "Added a new config option, ``shrink_threshold``, to specify the absolute " "size below which a shard will be considered for shrinking. This overrides " "the ``shard_shrink_point`` configuration option, which expressed this as a " "percentage of ``shard_container_threshold``. ``shard_shrink_point`` is now " "deprecated." msgstr "" "Added a new config option, ``shrink_threshold``, to specify the absolute " "size below which a shard will be considered for shrinking. This overrides " "the ``shard_shrink_point`` configuration option, which expressed this as a " "percentage of ``shard_container_threshold``. ``shard_shrink_point`` is now " "deprecated." msgid ""msgid "The correct storage policy is now logged for S3 requests." msgstr "The correct storage policy is now logged for S3 requests." msgid "" "The dark-data audit watcher now requires that all primary locations for an " "object's container agree that the data does not appear in listings to " "consider data \"dark\". Previously, a network partition that left an object " "node isolated could cause it to quarantine or delete all of its data." msgstr "" "The dark-data audit watcher now requires that all primary locations for an " "object's container agree that the data does not appear in listings to " "consider data \"dark\". Previously, a network partition that left an object " "node isolated could cause it to quarantine or delete all of its data." msgid "" "The dark-data audit watcher now skips objects younger than a new " "configurable ``grace_age`` period. This avoids issues where data could be " "flagged, quarantined, or deleted because of listing consistency issues. The " "default is one week." msgstr "" "The dark-data audit watcher now skips objects younger than a new " "configurable ``grace_age`` period. This avoids issues where data could be " "flagged, quarantined, or deleted because of listing consistency issues. The " "default is one week." msgid "" "The formpost middleware now properly supports uploading multiple files with " "different content-types." msgstr "" "The formpost middleware now properly supports uploading multiple files with " "different content-types." "The internal clients used by the container-reconciler, container-sharder, " "container-sync, and object-expirer daemons now use a more-descriptive " "``<daemon>-ic`` log name, rather than ``swift``. If you previously " "configured the ``log_name`` option in ``internal-client.conf``, you must now " "use the ``set log_name = <value>`` syntax to configure it, even if no value " "is set in the ``[DEFAULT]`` section. This may be done prior to upgrading." msgstr "" "The internal clients used by the container-reconciler, container-sharder, " "container-sync, and object-expirer daemons now use a more-descriptive " "``<daemon>-ic`` log name, rather than ``swift``. If you previously " "configured the ``log_name`` option in ``internal-client.conf``, you must now " "use the ``set log_name = <value>`` syntax to configure it, even if no value " "is set in the ``[DEFAULT]`` section. This may be done prior to upgrading." msgid ""msgid "The object-expirer logs fewer client disconnects." msgstr "The object-expirer logs fewer client disconnects." msgid "" "The object-expirer now only cleans up empty containers. Previously, it would " "attempt to delete all processed containers, regardless of whether there were " "entries which were skipped or had errors." msgstr "" "The object-expirer now only cleans up empty containers. Previously, it would " "attempt to delete all processed containers, regardless of whether there were " "entries which were skipped or had errors." msgid "" "The object-updater now defers rate-limited updates to the end of its cycle; " "these deferred updates will be processed (at the limited rate) until the " "configured ``interval`` elapses. A new ``max_deferred_updates`` option may " "be used to bound the deferral queue." msgstr "" "The object-updater now defers rate-limited updates to the end of its cycle; " "these deferred updates will be processed (at the limited rate) until the " "configured ``interval`` elapses. A new ``max_deferred_updates`` option may " "be used to bound the deferral queue." "The post-rsync REPLICATE call no longer recalculates hashes immediately." msgstr "" "The post-rsync REPLICATE call no longer recalculates hashes immediately." msgid "" "The proxy-server now caches 'listing' shards, improving listing performance " "for sharded containers. A new config option, " "``recheck_listing_shard_ranges``, controls the cache time and defaults to 10 " "minutes; set it to 0 to disable caching (the previous behavior)." msgstr "" "The proxy-server now caches 'listing' shards, improving listing performance " "for sharded containers. A new config option, " "``recheck_listing_shard_ranges``, controls the cache time and defaults to 10 " "minutes; set it to 0 to disable caching (the previous behaviour)." msgid "" "The reconciler now defers working on policies that have a partition power " "increase in progress to avoid issues with concurrent writes." msgstr "" "The reconciler now defers working on policies that have a partition power " "increase in progress to avoid issues with concurrent writes." msgid "" "The reconstructor now uses the replication network to fetch fragments for " "reconstruction." msgstr "" "The reconstructor now uses the replication network to fetch fragments for " "reconstruction." msgid "" "The relinker better handles data found from earlier partition power " "increases." msgstr "" "The relinker better handles data found from earlier partition power " "increases." msgid "" "The relinker better handles tombstones found for the same object but with " "different inodes." msgstr "" "The relinker better handles tombstones found for the same object but with " "different inodes." msgid "" "The relinker can now target specific storage policies or partitions by using " "the new ``--policy`` and ``--partition`` options." msgstr "" "The relinker can now target specific storage policies or partitions by using " "the new ``--policy`` and ``--partition`` options." msgid "" "The relinker now performs eventlet-hub selection the same way as other " "daemons. In particular, ``epolls`` will no longer be selected, as it seemed " "to cause occassional hangs." msgstr "" "The relinker now performs eventlet-hub selection the same way as other " "daemons. In particular, ``epolls`` will no longer be selected, as it seemed " "to cause occasional hangs." msgid "" "The relinker now spawns multiple subprocesses to process disks in parallel. " "By default, one worker is spawned per disk; use the new ``--workers`` option " "to control how many subprocesses are used. Use ``--workers=0`` to maintain " "the previous behavior." msgstr "" "The relinker now spawns multiple subprocesses to process disks in parallel. " "By default, one worker is spawned per disk; use the new ``--workers`` option " "to control how many subprocesses are used. Use ``--workers=0`` to maintain " "the previous behaviour." msgid "" "The sharder and swift-manage-shard-ranges now consider total row count " "(instead of just object count) when deciding whether a shard is a candidate " "for shrinking." msgstr "" "The sharder and swift-manage-shard-ranges now consider total row count " "(instead of just object count) when deciding whether a shard is a candidate " "for shrinking." msgid "" "The sharder daemon has been enhanced to better support the shrinking of " "shards that are no longer required. Shard containers will now discover from " "their root container if they should be shrinking. They will also discover " "the shards into which they should shrink, which may include the root " "container itself." msgstr "" "The sharder daemon has been enhanced to better support the shrinking of " "shards that are no longer required. Shard containers will now discover from " "their root container if they should be shrinking. They will also discover " "the shards into which they should shrink, which may include the root " "container itself." msgid ""msgid "This is the final stable branch that will support Python 2.7." msgstr "This is the final stable branch that will support Python 2.7." This addresses " "a potential hang in the proxy-server while logging client disconnects." msgstr "" "Turned off thread-logging when monkey-patching with eventlet. This addresses " "a potential hang in the proxy-server while logging client disconnects." msgid ""msgid "Updates are now sent over the replication network." msgstr "Updates are now sent over the replication network." msgid "" "Upon detecting a ring change, the reconstructor now only aborts the jobs for " "that ring and continues processing jobs for other rings." msgstr "" "Upon detecting a ring change, the reconstructor now only aborts the jobs for " "that ring and continues processing jobs for other rings." msgid "Warn when relinking/cleaning up and any disks are unmounted." msgstr "Warn when relinking/cleaning up and any disks are unmounted." "When building a listing from shards, any failure to retrieve listings will " "result in a 503 response. Previously, failures fetching a partiucular shard " "would result in a gap in listings." msgstr "" "When building a listing from shards, any failure to retrieve listings will " "result in a 503 response. commit_message:
shell: Add --filter option

Adds the ability to do some basic client-side filtering. Currently
available filters include

  * Byte size filters:

    bytes > 1K
    bytes < 100
    bytes == 1MB
    bytes in (1MB, 1GB]

  * Prefix filters (though the separate --prefix option is still
    generally preferred):

    prefix == "foo"
    prefix in ("bar", "baz")

  * Infix filters:

    "foo" in name

  * Suffix filters:

    suffix == "foo"
    suffix in ("bar", "baz")

Change-Id: Ic3ce82f4cb5fe53ff7f95bfb8f0864b1154ef740

commit_message:
Add steps on checking the stored image to verification guide

This commit adds a final step the verification page in the Glance
install guide to actually check the stored image in glance matches the
upload. This is an important step of the verification process to make
sure that everything in the install is 100% operational. Personally it
was something I had trouble with in my local cloud install (which I
documented here: http://blog.kortar.org/?p=380 ) and ensuring the stored
data matches the uploaded data is just a good sanity check to verify the
install.

Change-Id: I69c84ba7e090a5eb83f412d8ac14819522658e70
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/74/486674/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. Download the uploaded image and validate it matches what was uploaded: .. code-block:: console $ openstack image save --file cirros_down.img cirros $ diff cirros_down.img cirros-0.3.5-x86_64-disk.img There should be no output to either command, which will indicate the downloaded image matches exactly what was uploaded. If the diff returns an error like: "Binary files cirros_down.img and cirros-0.3.5-x86_64-disk.img differ" than that means what was downloaded from Glance does not match the uploaded image.

commit_message:
Allow users to list containers/objects by size.

$ swift list test -l --size +1024
    10485760 2018-03-21 03:16:24 application/octet-stream 10MB
    16779848 2018-03-21 05:19:59          application/pdf 16MB.pdf
    27265608

$ swift list test-1 -l -S 400-1024
         435 2018-03-21 03:16:10 application/octet-stream x.cfg
         435

$ swift list -l -size +409600
   31      1576061 2015-12-16 02:51:28 test
    8     36081048 2019-12-19 03:14:35 test+segments
   36       564225 2018-03-21 16:15:12 test-1
   75     38221334

Change-Id: I9c0de0be90da4c2a3668b79a436aac1531447064

subject: update nova-next and nova-ovs-hybrid-plug to disable linuxbridge

neutron now declares linuxbridge experimental and requires
it to be enabled by a new config option. We do not set
that in these jobs so the neutron server fails to load
since we enable the linux bridge mech driver.

we do not actully use linuxbridge in these jobs so this patch

Change-Id: I129a850c3327498d26d899c7709f5749622afdd8
Closes-Bug: #1980948

commit_message:
update nova-next and nova-ovs-hybrid-plug to disable linuxbridge

neutron now declares linuxbridge experimental and requires
it to be enabled by a new config option. We do not set
that in these jobs so the neutron server fails to load
since we enable the linux bridge mech driver.

we do not actully use linuxbridge in these jobs so this patch
just disables the mech driver.

Change-Id: I129a850c3327498d26d899c7709f5749622afdd8

commit_message:
Add featureset027 group into tempest-allow

This add featureset027 group in tempest-allow
to be used with featureset027 jobs.

Here is the def which is been replaced in this patch:- https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/src/branch/master/config/general_config/featureset027.yml#L88
Change-Id: I627a4cf16f8e668d581bd957fc46629aae20c206

commit_message:
Implement API protection testing for metadef resource types

This commit adds some basic protection tests so that we can start
testing the secure RBAC changes proposed to glance.

NOTE: Instead of having follow up patch, removing the lock from
namespace tests in this patch only. The lock was added earlier
to execute metadef tests serially and avoid conflicts.

Depends-On: Ia0809b2b27ac8cf9325e264b3298149feea07eb4
Change-Id: Iccc0e8dbbb726b532a91cb35f030c032046fc4c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-tempest-plugin refs/changes/92/802792/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import abc from tempest.api.image import base from tempest import config from tempest.lib import decorators from tempest.lib import exceptions from glance_tempest_plugin.tests.rbac.v2 import base as rbac_base CONF = config.CONF class MetadefV2RbacResourceTypeTest(rbac_base.ImageV2RbacBaseTests, metaclass=abc.ABCMeta): @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super().setup_clients() cls.persona = getattr(cls, f'os_{cls.credentials[0]}') cls.client = cls.persona.resource_types_client @classmethod def setup_credentials(cls): super().setup_credentials() cls.os_primary = getattr(cls, f'os_{cls.credentials[0]}') @abc.abstractmethod def test_create_resource_type(self): """Test add_metadef_resource_type_association policy.""" pass @abc.abstractmethod def test_get_resource_type(self): """Test get_metadef_resource_type policy.""" pass @abc.abstractmethod def test_list_resource_types(self): """Test list_metadef_resource_types policy.""" pass @abc.abstractmethod def test_delete_resource_type(self): """Test remove_metadef_resource_type_association policy.""" pass class SystemAdminTests(MetadefV2RbacResourceTypeTest, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['system_admin', 'project_admin'] @decorators.skip_because(bug='968696') def test_create_resource_type(self): pass @decorators.skip_because(bug='968696') def test_get_resource_type(self): pass @decorators.skip_because(bug='968696') def test_list_resource_types(self): pass @decorators.skip_because(bug='968696') def test_delete_resource_type(self): pass class SystemMemberTests(SystemAdminTests, base.BaseV2ImageTest): credentials = ['system_member', 'project_admin', 'system_admin'] class SystemReaderTests(SystemMemberTests, base.BaseV2ImageTest): credentials = ['system_reader', 'project_admin', 'system_admin'] class ProjectAdminTests(MetadefV2RbacResourceTypeTest, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['project_admin', 'system_admin'] def _create_resource_types(self, namespaces, client=None): resource_types = [] for namespace in namespaces: resource_type_name = "rs_type_of_%s" % (namespace['namespace']) self.do_request('create_resource_type_association', expected_status=201, client=client, namespace_id=namespace['namespace'], name=resource_type_name) resource_types_with_ns = {} resource_types_with_ns['namespace'] = namespace resource_types_with_ns['resource_type'] = resource_type_name resource_types.append(resource_types_with_ns) self.addCleanup(self._cleanup_namespace, namespace) return resource_types def test_create_resource_type(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create resource types for above created namespaces by admin _ = self._create_resource_types( ns_A, self.resource_type_client) _ = self._create_resource_types( ns_B, client=project_client.resource_types_client) def test_get_resource_type(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create resource types for above created namespaces resource_type_A = self._create_resource_types( ns_A, self.resource_type_client) resource_type_B = self._create_resource_types( ns_B, client=project_client.resource_types_client) # Get all resource type with admin role rs_types = resource_type_A + resource_type_B for rs in rs_types: self.do_request('list_resource_type_association', expected_status=200, namespace_id=rs['namespace']['namespace']) def test_list_resource_types(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create resource types for above created namespaces resource_types_A = self._create_resource_types( ns_A, self.resource_type_client) resource_types_B = self._create_resource_types( ns_B, client=project_client.resource_types_client) # List all the resource types by admin role resp = self.do_request('list_resource_types', expected_status=200, client=self.resource_type_client) resource_type_names = set(rt['name'] for rt in resp['resource_types']) rs_types = resource_types_A + resource_types_B for rs in rs_types: self.assertIn(rs['resource_type'], resource_type_names) def test_delete_resource_type(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create resource types for above created namespaces resource_types_A = self._create_resource_types( ns_A, self.resource_type_client) resource_types_B = self._create_resource_types( ns_B, client=project_client.resource_types_client) # Get all resource type by project A with admin role rs_types = resource_types_A + resource_types_B for rs in rs_types: self.do_request('delete_resource_type_association', expected_status=204, namespace_id=rs['namespace']['namespace'], resource_name=rs['resource_type']) class ProjectMemberTests(ProjectAdminTests, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['project_member', 'project_admin', 'system_admin'] def test_create_resource_type(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create resource types for above created namespaces by admin role namespaces = ns_A + ns_B for namespace in namespaces: resource_type_name = "rs_type_of_%s" % (namespace['namespace']) self.do_request('create_resource_type_association', expected_status=exceptions.Forbidden, namespace_id=namespace['namespace'], name=resource_type_name) self.addCleanup(self._cleanup_namespace, namespace) def test_get_resource_type(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create resource types for above created namespaces resource_types_A = self._create_resource_types( ns_A, self.resource_type_client) resource_types_B = self._create_resource_types( ns_B, client=project_client.resource_types_client) # Get all resource types by non admin role of project C rs_types = resource_types_A + resource_types_B for rs in rs_types: if rs['namespace']['visibility'] == 'public': self.do_request('list_resource_type_association', expected_status=200, namespace_id=rs['namespace']['namespace']) else: self.do_request('list_resource_type_association', expected_status=exceptions.Forbidden, namespace_id=rs['namespace']['namespace']) def test_list_resource_types(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create resource types for above created namespaces resource_types_A = self._create_resource_types( ns_A, self.resource_type_client) resource_types_B = self._create_resource_types( ns_B, client=project_client.resource_types_client) # List all the resource types with non admin role resp = self.do_request('list_resource_types', expected_status=200) resource_type_names = set(rt['name'] for rt in resp['resource_types']) rs_types = resource_types_A + resource_types_B for rs in rs_types: self.assertIn(rs['resource_type'], resource_type_names) def test_delete_resource_type(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create resource types for above created namespaces resource_types_A = self._create_resource_types( ns_A, self.resource_type_client) resource_types_B = self._create_resource_types( ns_B, client=project_client.resource_types_client) # Delete resource type is not allowed for non admin role rs_types = resource_types_A + resource_types_B for rs in rs_types: self.do_request('delete_resource_type_association', expected_status=exceptions.Forbidden, namespace_id=rs['namespace']['namespace'], resource_name=rs['resource_type']) class ProjectReaderTests(ProjectMemberTests, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['project_reader', 'project_admin', 'system_admin']

commit_message:
Backport improvements to catalog_service

- Adds tests
- Update docs
- Add option aliases

This patch do the following:

* Update catalog_service to use new openstacksdk
* Add catalog_service role to test catalog_service module

Change-Id: I6778f5e91cb0ead63cede28af0111d7ffbbf3ab1
(cherry picked from commit 7c7e61d36b56debccdcc02695bbe6f06010bb487)

commit_message:
sharder: fix probe tests skipping conditions

Previously all sharder probe tests were skipped if auto-sharding was
not configured for the test cluster. This is now fixed so that only
tests that require auto-sharding are skipped.

Change-Id: Icefc6441f8d48a0d418a4ab70b778b48ffdcbb59

commit_message:
[OSC] Add OSC Functional Tests Share Actions

Adds osc functional tests for share resize, revert,
adopt, and abandon.
Added '--wait' functionality to openstack share revert command.

Partially-implements: bp openstack-client-support
Change-Id: Ibaad237187882e313044a50e2dd38f91abfb05ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-manilaclient refs/changes/29/842429/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create_snapshot(self, share, name=None, description=None, force=None, add_cleanup=True): name = name or data_utils.rand_name('autotest_snapshot_name') cmd = ('snapshot create ' '%(share)s %(name)s %(desc)s' % {'share': share, 'name': '--name %s' % name, 'desc': '--description %s' % description}) cmd = cmd +' --wait' if force: cmd = cmd + ' --force %s' % force snapshot_object = self.dict_result('share', cmd) self._wait_for_object_status( 'share snapshot', snapshot_object['id'], 'available') if add_cleanup: self.addCleanup( self.openstack, 'share snapshot delete %s' % snapshot_object['id'] ) return snapshot_object

commit_message:
Move logging out of skip_automated_cleaning

Simply boolean functions should not have logging as a side effect.
This one is also used in deploy_utils without logging.

Change-Id: Iaa398f09cec06a8417c595acac19b0b9f3f3a871

commit_message:
Remove Python 2 support

Python 2 has been deprecated for almost two years, and has not been
guaranteed to work with glance_store for a while. This patch removes all
traces of six, unicode strings and Python 2 tweaks.

Co-Authored-By: Cyril Roelandt <cyril@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ifa78924d7ecf4f2d9a54c677888ab2926530c487

commit_message:
[DOC] Replace references to policy.json

The override file now supports yaml format. While
JSON formatting is absolutely fine, the file suffix
".json" will confuse our tooling.

Change-Id: I01ce4ab3e879a8dbbc7377997f7e497f15c9b15e
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Doc: Glance group management

Change-Id: If8798525aff5195e77f451dfce6c45cfaf16eaf4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/17/797117/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _glance-groups: ===================================== Glance Groups in Gerrit and Launchpad ===================================== Glance-related groups in Launchpad ================================== .. list-table:: :header-rows: 1 * - group - what - who - where * - "Glance" team - not sure, exactly - an "open" team, anyone with a Launchpad account can join - https://launchpad.net/~glance * - "Glance Bug Team" team - can triage (change status fields) on bugs - an "open" team, people self-nominate - https://launchpad.net/~glance-bugs * - "Glance Drivers" team - not sure, exactly - Anyone who is interested in doing some work, has a Launchpad account, and is approved by the current members - https://launchpad.net/~glance-drivers * - "Glance Release" team - Maintains the Launchpad space for Glance, glance_store, python-glanceclient, and glance-tempest-plugin - Anyone who is interested in doing some work, has a Launchpad account, and is approved by the current members - https://launchpad.net/~glance-release * - "Glance Core security contacts" team - can see and work on private security bugs while they are under embargo - subset of glance-core (the OpenStack Vulnerablity Management Team likes to keep this team small), so even though the PTL can add people, you should propose them on the mailing list first. - https://launchpad.net/~glance-coresec Glance-related groups in Gerrit =============================== The Glance project has total control over the membership of these groups. .. list-table:: :header-rows: 1 * - group - what - who - where * - glance-ptl - Current Glance PTL - glance ptl - https://review.opendev.org/admin/groups/3a2d24a98c24482a0371a4762ba0c1b3ade078b8,members * - glance-core - +2 powers in Glance project code repositories - glance core reviewers - https://review.opendev.org/admin/groups/1d14a0536e224488ae2c442c499ad16dddcdf8b8,members * - glance-specs-core - +2 powers in glance-specs repository - glance-core (plus others if appropriate; currently only glance-core) - https://review.opendev.org/admin/groups/b922792a1e96d66b0fc3b2cdbb6aaad7ae9eeefe,members * - glance-tempest-plugin-core - +2 powers on the glance-tempest-plugin repository - glance-core plus other appropriate people - https://review.opendev.org/admin/groups/0231143f107f488b7525707b3547b7eac26471ec,members The Glance project shares control over the membership of these groups. If you want to add someone to one of these groups who doesn't already have membership by being in an included group, be sure to include the other groups or individual members in your proposal email. .. list-table:: :header-rows: 1 * - group - what - who - where * - glance-stable-maint - +2 powers on backports to stable branches - subset of glance-core (subject to approval by stable-maint-core) plus the stable-maint-core team - https://review.opendev.org/admin/groups/6a290a73668d7cdefb7bdfdc5a85f9adb61bbaa5,members NOTE: The following groups exist, but I don't think they are used for anything anymore. .. list-table:: :header-rows: 1 * - group - where * - glance-release - https://review.opendev.org/admin/groups/a405991a32b8d5cbc975db4c956cb11d04805192,members * - glance-release-branch - https://review.opendev.org/admin/groups/fe8ee0c76e7a0bf4b33afbb81741ec4daca50ed4,members How Gerrit groups are connected to project repositories ------------------------------------------------------- The connection between the groups defined in gerrit and what they can do is defined in the project-config repository: https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config * ``gerrit/projects.yaml`` sets the config file for a project * ``gerrit/acls`` contains the config files

commit_message:
Nova: Start nova-compute after its NFS backend is ready

When Nova NFS backend is enabled, all instance data is stored in
the NFS storage, and the storage access should be ready when
the nova-compute service is started.

That's the one which fixes possible wrong permissions in /var/lib/nova/
issues by enforcing that ordering by additional systemd service
dependency.

Note: nova_statedir_owner is a one-off init container executed in
step_3, while NFS mounts are created earlier by the host prep tasks.
Here everything is set properly and needs no explicit dependencies.

Co-authored-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Related: rhbz#2041360
Closes-Bug: #1977992
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/839295
Change-Id: I88f2b849a846a67088b9055faa4747f22b583580

commit_message:
Add validation to share network

Adds a check when associating a security service to a share network, so
that both resources must have the same project_id. If not,
a HTTP Bad Request is raised. Affiliated tests were altered or created.

Closes-Bug: #1918323
Change-Id: Idb2a8838d492ac3c616fb21ab1272f7dc74ee589
(cherry picked from commit a97d65d3eb9b3a5b4a88a1b3f22b59ca2f75c9bc)
(cherry picked from commit 95099bdfc46f4734c082b051a0029627aff9e473)
(cherry picked from commit 65fe79297d23e391d0746216520da957fc568000)

subject: Fix to get HOME environment in dhcp-provisioning validation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-20 09:17:20.000000000', 'files': ['roles/dhcp_validations/tasks/dhcp-provisioning.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations/commit/8e4958cd7575c8c42da02976b4fad1e4f30924c7', 'message': 'Fix to get HOME environment in dhcp-provisioning validation

The validation of dhcp-provisioning fails because it doesn't see
the correct path of undercloud.conf. The playbook has "become: true",
so the ansible_env.HOME is the home directory of root.

lookup(env, HOME) can get the home directory for the user.

Change-Id: I7c7de26f09f36d88b777be76027ad4ac66deda6b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix to get HOME environment in dhcp-provisioning validation

The validation of dhcp-provisioning fails because it doesn't see
the correct path of undercloud.conf. The playbook has "become: true",
so the ansible_env.HOME is the home directory of root.

lookup(env, HOME) can get the home directory for the user.

Change-Id: I7c7de26f09f36d88b777be76027ad4ac66deda6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/89/846589/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: path: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/undercloud.conf"

commit_message:
glance-cache-prefetcher: Set up access to multistore backends

... because the command requires access to backend stores to pull image
data.

Closes-Bug: #1979699

(cherry picked from commit 6964e627d5b98c2034aea4bebb72cdab7549b6b5)

commit_message:
Fix disabled UDP pools

Disabling a UDP pool didn't disable it correctly, requests were still
forwarded to the members.
Now, when disabling a UDP pool, the members are removed from the
configuration file.

Story 2010011
Task 45164

Change-Id: I7d92b011455d95a2df7782984b8f4648d4b00941
(cherry picked from commit f4b32ac313d751f81b90438cbedb7fd941322c61)

commit_message:
Check if stdin has isatty attribute

When the stdin is closed, it has no isatty atrribute which leads to a KeyError.

Closes-Bug: #1980890
Change-Id: If9a3bf68b8dfd953b346697241166578d18bb563

commit_message:
Bump tox minversion to 3.18.0

Since tox 3.18.0, the whitelist_externals option has been deprecated in
favor of the new allow_list_externals option[1].

This change bumps the minversion of tox so that we can replace
the deprecated option.

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: I76f328b8bed1338ab5496d21e54a4b0ff9251147
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/79/842879/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: minversion = 2.0whitelist_externals =

commit_message:
Switch centos-8-stream jobs to centos-9-stream jobs

Add octavia-v2-dsvm-scenario-centos-9-stream to the check pipeline.
Add a periodic job that builds and publishes c9s amphora images.

centos-8-stream jobs are removed because its default python version is
too old for installing projects from master branches.

Change-Id: Ief23b3fb6f4cedd2866e34c6de184e643d6789ec

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-04 22:33:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/7ac45c587ca611466d9875b2fa8734ea6ab67734', 'message': 'Eliminate Redundant Downloads

commit_message:
WIP: Eliminate Redundant Downloads

Currently, when multiple requests to download an un-cached image
arrive around the same time, Glance ends up downloading the image
data multiple times, once for each request, from the backend.

To prevent multiple concurrent downloads of un-cached images, this
change attempts to serve images out of cache that are not completely
downloaded yet. If an image is currently being cached, it serves all
further downloads of that image from the incomplete cache file, if
one exists.

Partially implements: blueprint duplicate-downloads

Change-Id: I2a348c25efa7707bfc51fa38600e492d98aa525c

commit_message:
[WIP] Add image import schema

Add /v2/schemas/image/import schema.
Perform schema validation on import input.

Change-Id: I3c3122a0b6706b9510e1d2a92140fb901ea28a9f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/72/312972/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import jsonschema from glance.i18n import __IMPORT_SCHEMA = { "type": "object", "properties": { "method": { "type": "object", "properties": { "name": {"type": "string"}, }, "required": ["name"] }, "source_disk_format": { "description": _("Allowed source disk formats."), "enum": [ "raw", ], "type": "string" }, "source_container_format": { "description": _("Allowed source container formats."), "enum": [ "bare", ], "type": "string" }, "os_type": { "description": _("Operating system type."), "enum": [ "linux", "windows", "other", ], "type": "string" }, }, "required": ["method", "source_disk_format", "source_container_format", "os_type"] } def validate_schema(self, body): try: jsonschema.validate(body, _IMPORT_SCHEMA) except jsonschema.ValidationError as e: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=e.message) def image_import(self, req, body, image_id): self.validate_schema(body) def get_import_schema(): schema = _IMPORT_SCHEMA schema['name'] = 'import' return schema
deleted_lines: def image_import(self, req, body, image_id):

commit_message:
[WIP] Validate image properties

Validate extra_properties on image creation.

Need to discuss if should create policy.json and use property_rules to
do such things.

Change-Id: Ic916dbf84442363958241715416551877298dfdc
Co-authored-by: Kristine Bujold <kristine.bujold@windriver.com>
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/73/616873/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from glance.i18n import _, _LI, _LW self._validate_image_properties(req, extra_properties) def _validate_image_properties(self, req, properties): if not properties: return """ validate hw_wrs_live_migration_max_downtime property """ prop_value = properties.get('hw_wrs_live_migration_max_downtime') if prop_value: LOG.info(_LI('hw_wrs_live_migration_max_downtime: %s') % prop_value) try: prop_value = int(prop_value) except ValueError: msg = _('hw_wrs_live_migration_max_downtime must ' 'be a number greater than or equal to ' '100, value: %s') % prop_value raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg, request=req) if prop_value < 100: msg = _('hw_wrs_live_migration_max_downtime must ' 'be a number greater than or equal to ' '100, value: %s') % prop_value raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg, request=req) """ validate hw_wrs_live_migration_timeout property """ prop_value = properties.get('hw_wrs_live_migration_timeout') if prop_value: LOG.info(_LI('hw_wrs_live_migration_timeout: %s') % prop_value) try: prop_value = int(prop_value) except ValueError: msg = _('hw_wrs_live_migration_timeout must be a number ' 'between 120 and 800 or 0, value: %s') % prop_value raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg, request=req) if prop_value != 0: if prop_value < 120 or prop_value > 800: msg = _('hw_wrs_live_migration_timeout must ' 'be a number between 120 and 800 or 0,' ' value: %s') % prop_value raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg, request=req) """ validate sw_wrs_auto_recovery property """ prop_value = properties.get('sw_wrs_auto_recovery') if prop_value: LOG.info(_LI('sw_wrs_auto_recovery: %s') % prop_value) auto_recovery = prop_value.lower() if 'false' == auto_recovery: properties['sw_wrs_auto_recovery'] = 'False' elif 'true' == auto_recovery: properties['sw_wrs_auto_recovery'] = 'True' else: msg = _('sw_wrs_auto_recovery must be True or False, ' 'value: %s') % prop_value raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg, request=req)
deleted_lines: from glance.i18n import _, _LW

commit_message:
Fix URLs in the form docs.openstack.org/developer/$project

These URLs are now in the form docs.openstack.org/$project/latest. Make
sure to use always use https for these URLs.

Change-Id: I4a75bb6097399efca373d2f9a0e8697eb92312a7

subject: [WIP] Add graceful shutdown for api and registry
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-11-14 08:56:33.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/exception.py', 'glance/common/wsgi.py', 'etc/glance-api.conf', 'etc/glance-registry.conf'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/acbe5eaa92d6f35d64f32f8780e2656035d758c5', 'message': '[WIP] Add graceful shutdown for api and registry

RAW Caching exists the last and does not need any soft shutdown
procedure as it already supports safe restarts.

Ensure that glance wsgi worker processes terminate when their parent
dies unexpectedly and that glance wsgi child worker processes do not
hang during graceful termination.

This will register the child processes to detect a parent pipe has been
broken and basically ports in the same code that exists in oslo_service
for how the child worker processes detect their parent has terminated
unexpectedly

Wait up to one second before doing a hard exit of a child wsgi worker
process. When doing a graceful and clean shutdown the process could hang
on the eventlet pool. This code waits up to a second and then does an
instantaneous shutdown. glance-api seemed to encounter this hang more
frequently than most processes.

Change-Id: I72a9c2e84d72f044062f0a364a28c687c026c4f4
Co-authored-by: Ovidiu Poncea <ovidiu.poncea@windriver.com>
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Add graceful shutdown for api and registry

RAW Caching exists the last and does not need any soft shutdown
procedure as it already supports safe restarts.

Ensure that glance wsgi worker processes terminate when their parent
dies unexpectedly and that glance wsgi child worker processes do not
hang during graceful termination.

This will register the child processes to detect a parent pipe has been
broken and basically ports in the same code that exists in oslo_service
for how the child worker processes detect their parent has terminated
unexpectedly

Wait up to one second before doing a hard exit of a child wsgi worker
process. When doing a graceful and clean shutdown the process could hang
on the eventlet pool. This code waits up to a second and then does an
instantaneous shutdown. glance-api seemed to encounter this hang more
frequently than most processes.

Change-Id: I72a9c2e84d72f044062f0a364a28c687c026c4f4
Co-authored-by: Ovidiu Poncea <ovidiu.poncea@windriver.com>
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>

subject: WIP: FakeImage test fixture is not reflective of reality
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-06-26 16:40:13.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/2d9269c4a7e2597a2db569a7cd86a36ebe08b521', 'message': 'WIP: FakeImage test fixture is not reflective of reality

Surely I must be wrong about this, but it looks to me like FakeImage
in the test_images_resource test is not a proper representation of
proxy.Image(), specifically around the image_id field. Presumably it
is reflective of the *external* REST representation of an image, but
is "close enough" that it got used extensively for mocking out the
result of DB calls as well. I'm putting this in a separate patch
because if this is true, the tests should probably be fixed in a
separate patch from any other changes. This hack is just here to show
that it makes the following patch work.

Is it possible that these tests have been wrong for a long time?

Change-Id: Ifc4b3bc5c2a09b9a54f3e3ccd7d4432c9d9b88fc
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: FakeImage test fixture is not reflective of reality

Surely I must be wrong about this, but it looks to me like FakeImage
in the test_images_resource test is not a proper representation of
proxy.Image(), specifically around the image_id field. Presumably it
is reflective of the *external* REST representation of an image, but
is "close enough" that it got used extensively for mocking out the
result of DB calls as well. I'm putting this in a separate patch
because if this is true, the tests should probably be fixed in a
separate patch from any other changes. This hack is just here to show
that it makes the following patch work.

Is it possible that these tests have been wrong for a long time?

Change-Id: Ifc4b3bc5c2a09b9a54f3e3ccd7d4432c9d9b88fc

Prevent attribute exception if marker doesn't exist

added_lines: v = getattr(marker, sort_key, None)
deleted_lines: v = getattr(marker, sort_key)

subject: Fixes inconsistent state of images due to failure in deletion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-31 11:17:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/5070582e356f37f29c72a4c6f871f9e4ddc27967', 'message': "Fixes inconsistent state of images due to failure in deletion

Glance image delete sets the status of image being deleted as
deleted or pending_delete, it then proceeds to backend_store to
delete the image. This leads to inconsistency in image status if,
any operation fails during execution. This fix introduces a new
status 'deleting'. For cases delayed_delete=False, first we set image
status=deleting and then proceed for store delete. For cases where
delayed_delete=True, image status is set to pending_delete as usual.
In scrubber, when image is being deleted, set status=deleting.
Post deleting in both cases, we set status=deleted and in case of
any error status becomes error.

Change-Id: I49eeaff4d4614136a5642a8e5b24d49e40d6d9d8
Closes-Bug: #1511061
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-31 17:28:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/702bb40801fdcb3395e00d4c65587180eb435926', 'message': "Fixes inconsistent state of images due to failure in deletion

Glance image delete sets the status of image being deleted as
deleted or pending_delete, it then proceeds to backend_store to
delete the image. This leads to inconsistency in image status if,
any operation fails during execution. This fix introduces a new
status 'deleting'. For cases delayed_delete=False, first we set image
status=deleting and then proceed for store delete. For cases where
delayed_delete=True, image status is set to pending_delete as usual.
In scrubber, when image is being deleted, set status=deleting.
Post deleting in both cases, we set status=deleted and in case of
any error status becomes error.

Change-Id: I49eeaff4d4614136a5642a8e5b24d49e40d6d9d8
Closes-Bug: #1511061
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-02-01 05:14:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/fdd946700a17e5a9cf6680c7523f73236467b1c8', 'message': "Fixes inconsistent state of images due to failure in deletion

Glance image delete sets the status of image being deleted as
deleted or pending_delete, it then proceeds to backend_store to
delete the image. This leads to inconsistency in image status if,
any operation fails during execution. This fix introduces a new
status 'deleting'. For cases delayed_delete=False, first we set image
status=deleting and then proceed for store delete. For cases where
delayed_delete=True, image status is set to pending_delete as usual.
In scrubber, when image is being deleted, set status=deleting.
Post deleting in both cases, we set status=deleted and in case of
any error status becomes error.

Change-Id: I49eeaff4d4614136a5642a8e5b24d49e40d6d9d8
Closes-Bug: #1511061
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2018-02-10 19:57:30.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/images.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'glance/api/v1/images.py', 'glance/domain/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_scrubber.py', 'glance/scrubber.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/c098c88c6081cc382e0e558e0498b6b14fe8ed71', 'message': "Fixes inconsistent state of images due to failure in deletion

Glance image delete sets the status of image being deleted as
deleted or pending_delete, it then proceeds to backend_store to
delete the image. This leads to inconsistency in image status if,
any operation fails during execution. This fix introduces a new
status 'deleting'. For cases delayed_delete=False, first we set image
status=deleting and then proceed for store delete. For cases where
delayed_delete=True, image status is set to pending_delete as usual.
In scrubber, when image is being deleted, set status=deleting.
Post deleting in both cases, we set status=deleted and in case of
any error status becomes error.

Change-Id: I49eeaff4d4614136a5642a8e5b24d49e40d6d9d8
Closes-Bug: #1511061
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes inconsistent state of images due to failure in deletion

Glance image delete sets the status of image being deleted as
deleted or pending_delete, it then proceeds to backend_store to
delete the image. This leads to inconsistency in image status if,
any operation fails during execution. This fix introduces a new
status 'deleting'. For cases delayed_delete=False, first we set image
status=deleting and then proceed for store delete. For cases where
delayed_delete=True, image status is set to pending_delete as usual.
In scrubber, when image is being deleted, set status=deleting.
Post deleting in both cases, we set status=deleted and in case of
any error status becomes error.

Change-Id: I49eeaff4d4614136a5642a8e5b24d49e40d6d9d8
Closes-Bug: #1511061
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/95/539495/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
update ci since linuxbridge is now experimental

neutron now considers linuxbridge to be experimental
This change enables the linuxbridge feature in the
linuxbridge job. we do not currently declare the
linuxbridge os-vif plug as experimental as it has
been stable for many release and we do not have an
experimental concept in os-vif.

Change-Id: Ia275d1c3a9a9cf63238cf354c8e7d93ed59097a2
Closes-Bug: #1980948
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-vif refs/changes/49/848949/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Bump SQLalchemy to version that supports PY3.9

Bumping SQLAlchemy to 1.3.14, which is first version supporting
Python 3.9 runtime, this hopefully addresses the issue reported.

Change-Id: I73f0c7c067fcab00a97cd925cad19edd64b6eb45
Closes-Bug: #1957167
(cherry picked from commit 71c1e4b18a47f94f3302f96c359a6d3e1453ff11)

commit_message:
Drop support for SQLite < 3.7

Both Ubuntu 18.04 [1] and CentOS 8 [2] provide sufficiently new versions
of SQLite that make this check unnecessary now.

[1] https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic/sqlite3
[2] http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/os/x86_64/Packages/

Change-Id: Ib2e267eb1ac5ef4da711b6f5bccc5eccfb4b6954

Add the ability to manipulate these.

commit_message:
Revert "Resolve compatibility with oslo.db future (redux)"

This reverts commit 9e002a77f2131d3594a2a4029a147beaf37f5b17.

We have determined that this causes a test timeout almost all of the
time on py36 only due to the opportunistic tests for DB migrations.
This revert is just to avoid having to block our gate or disable those
tests while we figure out what the right fix is.

Related-Bug: #1940460

Change-Id: I6d77adc0f1296bdcdea014dc36b849111e1c7f45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/35/805035/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Glance add retired image ids table
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-06 14:16:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/64ce00bcd4af0dfbaaec83c3a420253ec9d22162', 'message': "Glance retired images

Regarding OSSN-0075. One of the Glance spec alternatives is
to use a retired images table to store the image ids of images
which have been publicized or shared at any time.

This change adds a new table, 'retired_images'. This table only
needs one column, 'id'.

Updating images, and image members will add the image id to the
retired images table if it is public or shared. A duplicate
exception will be raised when creating an image with the same
UUID to prevent this vulnerability.

The tests include:

	- Migration test for the retired images table.
	- Creating a private image, making it public, deleting
		it and then purging the database.
	- Creating a public image, deleting it and then purging
		the database.
	- Creating a private image, where its id exists in the
		retired images table.

Glance spec: #Ic3878261fcbfbd40ef36d42f662b706b80759392
Change-Id: I295bbd7c02aa2f11697932f47e11e4e44ca231e7

commit_message:
Glance add retired image ids table

Regarding OSSN-0075. One of the Glance spec alternatives is
to use a retired images table to store the image ids of images
which have been publicized or shared at any time.

This change adds a new table, 'retired_images'. This table only
needs one column, 'id'.

Updating images, and image members will add the image id to the
retired images table if it is public or shared. A duplicate
exception will be raised when creating an image with the same
UUID to prevent this vulnerability.

The tests include:

        - Migration test for the retired images table.
        - Creating a private image, making it public, deleting
                it and then purging the database.
        - Creating a public image, deleting it and then purging
                the database.
        - Creating a private image, where its id exists in the
                retired images table.
        - The migration test will also check that all previous
                image ids have been inserted into the retired images
                table.

Glance spec: #Ic3878261fcbfbd40ef36d42f662b706b80759392
Change-Id: I295bbd7c02aa2f11697932f47e11e4e44ca231e7

commit_message:
Glance purge insecure warning

Regarding OSSN-0775. An alternative is to change the purge
command, by default, to raise an exception warning of the
security vulnerability. This can be bypassed using the --insecure
option.

The tests include:

	- All original purge tests are changed to using insecure
	- Testing secure purge

commit_message:
Glance purge ignore images table

Regarding OSSN-0775. The Glance spec current proposal is to
change the purge command so that the imade ids are unmodified.

This change changes purge to, by default, not purge the images
table. The --insecure argument is also added which will permit
purging of the images table. Using --insecure will not prevent
the vulnerability and should be used with caution.

The tests include:

	- All original purge tests are changed to using insecure
	- Testing secure purge

commit_message:
Set False to include_empty_option

In _populate_custom_choices(), all methods called at the method have
True as a second argument. It means that the default values sepcified
in a stack are not shown as default when launch stack form.
The fileds always show 'Select Flavor/Image/Network'.
Users doesn't expect to choose default value by hand.
This change shows the default values defined at a template.

Also, image_field_data() doesn't use parameter, include_empty_option.
This change modfies the method to change the behavior based on the
parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1619465
Change-Id: I4b6bef322a668a805abcd4bc472d30f6d1df3a0a
(cherry picked from commit 792f8cbe4ac6f39aa41b0905e3b68f2a8c1e5fb1)

commit_message:
utils.strip_version: properly handle all URLs

This patch makes sure utils.strip_version can handle URLs for which the
version of the endpoint is not specified right after the netloc, such as
http://foo.bar/image/v2.

Add unit tests as well.

Change-Id: Ic803199232c2c65259bd1afdbebe5ab9f865d8f4
Closes-Bug: #1748009

  - Remove share_network_subnet_id from share_servers
  - Create mapping table share_server_share_network_subnet_mappings
  - Fix queries with new db design
  - Add migration downgrade and upgrade alembic
  - Add share_network_subnet_id to the NetworkAllocations

- Manager:
  - Setup server allocates multiple subnets
  - Modify signature of driver _setup_server interface, passing a
    list of network_info for each subnet
  - Update share server DB creation to inform a list of subnets

- Dummy Driver:
  - Implement setup_server with new signature
  - Modify the backend_details to save allocations for all subnets
  - Report update allocation and share server multiple subnet support

Change-Id: I7de9de4ae509182e9494bba604979cce03acceec
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2022-01-28 17:58:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/a2c14d51e9f9fa0999516de620ebd52d7a325e6d', 'message': 'Add multiple subnets per AZ support

Manila can now configure a share network with multiple subnets
in an availability zone. Also, it can add a new subnet for an
availability that has share servers, which will triger an update
share server allocations.

Changes:
- API:
  - Bump version to 2.68.
  - setup share network with multiple subents per az.
  - Block manage server with multiple subnets.
  - Allow add subnet for in-use share servers.
  - `share_network_subnet_id` is dropped from ShareServer view
  - `share_network_subnet_ids` is added in ShareServer view
  - `network_allocation_update_support` is added to ShareServer and
    ShareNetwork views.

- DB:
  - Remove `share_network_subnet_id` from share_servers.
  - Create mapping table `share_server_share_network_subnet_mappings`.
  - Fix queries with new db design.
  - Add migration downgrade and upgrade alembic.
  - Add `share_network_subnet_id` to the NetworkAllocations.

- Scheduler:
  - Change `AvailabilityZoneFilter` to take in account if the
    host supports the allocation required by the setup request.

- Manager:
  - Bump RPC API version.
  - `_setup_server` allocating multiple subnets.
  - Modify signature of driver `_setup_server` interface, passing a
    list of `network_info` for each subnet.
  - Share server DB creation to inform a list of subnets and
    create with `network_allocation_update_support`.
  - Implement `check_update_share_server_network_allocations` and
    `update_share_server_network_allocations`.

- Drivers:
  - For legacy compatibility, all drivers implementing `_setup_server`
    consume the first element of the `network_ino`.
  - Dummy Driver:
    - Implement `_setup_server` with new signature as multiple subnet.
    - Modify the `backend_details` to save allocations for all subnets.
    - Report update allocation and share server multiple subnet support.
    - Implement `check_update_share_server_network_allocations` and
      `update_share_server_network_allocations` interfaces.

DocImpact
APIImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint multiple-share-network-subnets

Signed-off-by: Felipe Rodrigues <felipefuty01@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I7de9de4ae509182e9494bba604979cce03acceec

    host supports the allocation required by the setup request.

- Manager:
  - Bump RPC API version.
  - `_setup_server` allocating multiple subnets.
  - Modify signature of driver `_setup_server` interface, passing a
    list of `network_info` for each subnet.
  - Share server DB creation to inform a list of subnets and

    `update_share_server_network_allocations`.

    consume the first element of the `network_ino`.

    - Modify the `backend_details` to save allocations for all subnets.
    - Report update allocation and share server multiple subnet support.

      `update_share_server_network_allocations` interfaces.

  - Remove `share_network_subnet_id` from share_servers.
  - Create mapping table `share_server_share_network_subnet_mappings`.
  - Fix queries with new db design.
  - Add migration downgrade and upgrade alembic.
  - Add `share_network_subnet_id` to the NetworkAllocations.

- Scheduler:
  - Change `AvailabilityZoneFilter` to take in account if the
    host supports the allocation required by the setup request.

  - Bump RPC API version.

  - Modify signature of driver `_setup_server` interface, passing a
    list of `network_info` for each subnet.

  - Implement `check_update_share_server_network_allocations` and
    `update_share_server_network_allocations`.

    consume the first element of the `network_ino`.
  - Dummy Driver:
    - Implement `_setup_server` with new signature as multiple subnet.

    - Report update allocation and share server multiple subnet support.
    - Implement `check_update_share_server_network_allocations` and

  - `network_allocation_update_support` is added to ShareServer and
    ShareNetwork views.
  - Add a check operation for share network subnet create.

- DB:
  - Remove `share_network_subnet_id` from share_servers.
  - Create mapping table `share_server_share_network_subnet_mappings`.
  - Fix queries with new db design.
  - Add migration downgrade and upgrade alembic.
  - Add `share_network_subnet_id` to the NetworkAllocations.

- Scheduler:
  - Change `AvailabilityZoneFilter` to take in account if the
    host supports the allocation required by the setup request.

- Manager:
  - Bump RPC API version.
  - `_setup_server` allocating multiple subnets.
  - Modify signature of driver `_setup_server` interface, passing a
    list of `network_info` for each subnet.
  - Share server DB creation to inform a list of subnets and
    create with `network_allocation_update_support`.
  - Implement `check_update_share_server_network_allocations` and
    `update_share_server_network_allocations`.

- Drivers:
  - For legacy compatibility, all drivers implementing `_setup_server`
    consume the first element of the `network_ino`.
  - Dummy Driver:
    - Implement `_setup_server` with new signature as multiple subnet.
    - Modify the `backend_details` to save allocations for all subnets.
    - Report update allocation and share server multiple subnet support.
    - Implement `check_update_share_server_network_allocations` and
      `update_share_server_network_allocations` interfaces.

Signed-off-by: Felipe Rodrigues <felipefuty01@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andre Beltrami <debeltrami@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Fbio Oliveira <fabioaurelio1269@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nahim Alves de Souza <nahimsouza@outlook.com>
Co-Authored-By: Caique Mello <caique_mellosbo@hotmail.com>

DocImpact
APIImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint multiple-share-network-subnets

Change-Id: I7de9de4ae509182e9494bba604979cce03acceec

commit_message:
Add multiple subnets per AZ support

Manila can now configure a share network with multiple subnets
in an availability zone. Also, it can add a new subnet for an
availability that has share servers, which will triger an update
share server allocations.

Changes:
- API:
  - Bump version to 2.70.
  - setup share network with multiple subents per az.
  - Block manage server with multiple subnets.
  - Allow add subnet for in-use share servers.
  - `share_network_subnet_id` is dropped from ShareServer view
  - `share_network_subnet_ids` is added in ShareServer view
  - `network_allocation_update_support` is added to ShareServer and
    ShareNetwork views.
  - Add a check operation for share network subnet create.

- DB:
  - Remove `share_network_subnet_id` from share_servers.
  - Create mapping table `share_server_share_network_subnet_mappings`.
  - Fix queries with new db design.
  - Add migration downgrade and upgrade alembic.
  - Add `share_network_subnet_id` to the NetworkAllocations.

- Scheduler:
  - Change `AvailabilityZoneFilter` to take in account if the
    host supports the allocation required by the setup request.

- Manager:
  - Bump RPC API version.
  - `_setup_server` allocating multiple subnets.
  - Modify signature of driver `_setup_server` interface, passing a
    list of `network_info` for each subnet.
  - Share server DB creation to inform a list of subnets and
    create with `network_allocation_update_support`.
  - Implement `check_update_share_server_network_allocations` and
    `update_share_server_network_allocations`.

- Drivers:
  - For legacy compatibility, all drivers implementing `_setup_server`
    consume the first element of the `network_ino`.
  - Dummy Driver:
    - Implement `_setup_server` with new signature as multiple subnet.
    - Modify the `backend_details` to save allocations for all subnets.
    - Report update allocation and share server multiple subnet support.
    - Implement `check_update_share_server_network_allocations` and
      `update_share_server_network_allocations` interfaces.

Signed-off-by: Felipe Rodrigues <felipefuty01@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andre Beltrami <debeltrami@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Fbio Oliveira <fabioaurelio1269@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nahim Alves de Souza <nahimsouza@outlook.com>
Co-Authored-By: Caique Mello <caique_mellosbo@hotmail.com>

DocImpact
APIImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint multiple-share-network-subnets

Change-Id: I7de9de4ae509182e9494bba604979cce03acceec

commit_message:
Configure the oslo.concurrency lock_path

A recent change in os-brick [1], which is used by cinder backends,
requires external file locks. This patch adds support for configuring
the lock path, with a default value that matches the corresponding
lock paths used by other services that use os-brick (namely cinder
and nova).

[1] I6f7f7d19540361204d4ae3ead2bd6dcddb8fcd68

Closes-Bug: #1980539
Change-Id: I5ea6766656f4227a1c514777c03bbf78d4ac59cd
(cherry picked from commit 6f61ecd9c5b030817d0255fd8fd485722f9556f4)

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], dropping
the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

And switch to openstack-python3-zed-jobs

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Change-Id: Ice1fd6cd5a8e1a60aab1a2dfa508e94d99ab9acd

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I94cf080753cdb5498110430418cfa573ad4409b5

commit_message:
Calculating virtual size of image during creation

Size of image is computed during the treatment of the PUT
request, but the virtual size is never computed anywhere.
The "_Introspect" flow used to do this computation but
since the task API has been deprecated, that part is not
getting called.

Added virtual size computation after getting the location
of image.

Change-Id: I56615c3bf5491d1d1bd27ad00362ca97d82dd5cd
Closes-Bug: 1665037

subject: Raise 403 instead 404 for get metadef namespace
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-09 10:08:35.000000000', 'files': ['glance/db/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/eeb8b7ff0dc89fa364234b75dfd567061be9b169', 'message': 'Raise 403 instead 404 for get metadef namespace

Currently HTTP 404 is being raised from db layer when private
namespace is accessed by other tenant. Ideally it should raise
HTTP 403 since the namespace is available but just not authorized
to be accessed.

Raising Forbidden instead of Notfound.

Change-Id: Ibf3c8a6ab3e64dee4bbacd1a2572ab439be2d961
'}]
commit_message:
Raise 403 instead 404 for get metadef namespace

Currently HTTP 404 is being raised from db layer when private
namespace is accessed by other tenant. Ideally it should raise
HTTP 403 since the namespace is available but just not authorized
to be accessed.

Raising Forbidden instead of Notfound.

Change-Id: Ibf3c8a6ab3e64dee4bbacd1a2572ab439be2d961
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/75/800175/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Stop logging sensitive login information

usernames and passwords must never be logged
by the service, even in debug mode.

Change-Id: I8eda1c849d0d1916345959178f32756e8a1e9c0e
Closes-Bug: #1976370
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 517966292af2eccb4f98520aba4374f463de21c9)
(cherry picked from commit 48f4bf6a168a8ec59ea26e44e1bdcf262ae96e90)

commit_message:
[update] Tell subscription-manager it's not running in a container.

Due to issue in podman[1], some file on the hypervisor might fool
subscription-manager into thinking that it's running inside a
container.

We hardcode the fact that it's not so that we are not impacted.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2097694

Change-Id: Idd526622c2c7ecf84ecde23311c5fbae9be82a0b
(cherry picked from commit 49658db7be3b10a2ae20a2b8cad6205fd7d4b4f9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/44/848744/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: environment: SMDEV_CONTAINER_OFF: True

commit_message:
Fix driver-agent cleanup

The cleanup function (that handles graceful shutdown) of the Octavia
driver-agent didn't work properly, the threads that were spawned for
stopping the Unix listeners were stuck (deadlock), so the threads leaked
and the join functions in the caller didn't return.

Now the code uses a thread for handling the connections, and the
shutdown function is called from the process.

Story 2010052
Task 45468

Change-Id: Ida33a1a24eab2706902b1ce3cca704d51fa6a599
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/48/843248/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: threading.Thread(target=server.serve_forever).start() exit_event.wait() server.shutdown() threading.Thread(target=server.serve_forever).start() exit_event.wait() server.shutdown() threading.Thread(target=server.serve_forever).start() exit_event.wait() server.shutdown()
deleted_lines: while not exit_event.is_set(): server.handle_request() # Can't shut ourselves down as we would deadlock, spawn a thread threading.Thread(target=server.shutdown).start() while not exit_event.is_set(): server.handle_request() # Can't shut ourselves down as we would deadlock, spawn a thread threading.Thread(target=server.shutdown).start() while not exit_event.is_set(): server.handle_request() # Can't shut ourselves down as we would deadlock, spawn a thread threading.Thread(target=server.shutdown).start()

subject: [NetApp] Fix HTTPS connection for python 3.7
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-06-02 15:00:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/2e2499ba1cab1b1e521a2f4203e3486835b71f38', 'message': '[NetApp] Fix HTTPS connection for python 3.7

With python3.7, the eventlet is breaking the ssl.py, so the https
is not working. This patch fixes it by changing the request library
(urllib by requests), the new library can be built over the
pyopenssl.py instead of ssl.py. It also adds two new netapp config
parameters:
"netapp_ssl_verify" a boolean showing whether the https connection
should verify the server certificate or not.
"netapp_ssl_cert" string specifying the CA or the CA directory to
be used to verify the server certificate.

Closes-Bug: #1880736
Change-Id: Id24436e30ef5720cc81e72facf5b25e263cba5fe
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-08-04 21:41:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/acc081cf4a612a51b5f17e17c65763942c45dffc', 'message': '[NetApp] Fix HTTPS connection for python 3.7

is not working. This patch fixes it by changing the request library

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix HTTPS connection for python 3.7

With python3.7, the eventlet is breaking the ssl.py, so the https
is not working. This patch fixes it by changing the request library
(urllib by requests), the new library can be built over the
pyopenssl.py instead of ssl.py.

Closes-Bug: #1880736
Change-Id: Id24436e30ef5720cc81e72facf5b25e263cba5fe

commit_message:
Split CI tests for security_group and security_group_rule modules

Previously, all security_group{,_info} and security_group_rule{,_info}
modules were tested in the same Ansible role. This patch splits
tests into two separate Ansible roles to increase readibility and
prevent variable name conflicts, e.g. for expected_fields.

Change-Id: Ifc28435147b3bfe88d4ee5e176469a53b7395dc0

commit_message:
Add "openstack network replace --tag" command

build "neutron tag-replace" command into openstack integrated
command into "openstack network replace --tag" with test codes.

(neutron tag-add & tag-remove are already built with openstack
network set --tag & openstack network unset --network respectively.)

setup.cfg, network.rst & neutron.csv files in the doc folder
also updated in this patch.

Change-Id: Ic086a9a4cea88dc3f210c46d301d117fc644cecf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/08/817208/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Designate: create proxy ports on external VIP to access miniDNS workers

While miniDNS servers are hosted on the internalAPI, they each need to
be accessible from external DNS servers to perform syncing. This is done
by doing a port->host mapping on haproxy.

Conflicts:
  manifests/haproxy.pp

This patch squashes in Icf9d686f9e551adb09a154a3e57fac71f12ddbb7 to
add support for non-backend syntax case present in wallaby.

Change-Id: I02f9f62be21b5f6c3c6edfb3cc2722ca5863d8c8
(cherry picked from commit a15c5f8721b81f4976b4d35f2efaf10c808badfd)

added_lines: # [*designate_mdns_proxy_baseport*] # (optional) Specify the base port value for the external->internal # proxies used for external DNS integration with designate workers. # Defaults to hiera('designate_mdns_public_port_start', undef) # $designate_mdns_proxy_baseport = hiera('designate_mdns_public_port_start', 16000), $service_ports = {}, # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $activate_httplog = undef # Create a reverse proxy for each miniDNS server running on the internal network so # external bind instances can access them without having to have access to the internal # network. # if $designate_mdns_proxy_baseport { $mdns_nodes = zip(hiera('designate_mdns_node_ips', $controller_hosts_real), hiera('designate_mdns_node_names', $controller_hosts_names_real)) # TODO(beagles): it would preferable to implement in terms of # tripleo::haproxy::endpoint. commit_message:
Don't import module "etcd3gw" if etcd3gw backend is not used.

If module etcd3gw is not required for used backend,
then no need to have it installed and imported.
Otherwise we always have ugly log error:
Could not load 'oslo_cache.etcd3gw': No module named 'etcd3gw': ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'etcd3gw

Closes-Bug: 1928318
Change-Id: Icbe6dc3e93b4d2fec1ceb88366027294e49d7032
(cherry picked from commit 40946a9349407f36a43d5020d991085c11468698)
(cherry picked from commit 3df5e9001346d17994deb8db60361cf8589a6230)
(cherry picked from commit f0ddb8a63f8b36224b365c962004f17f83dd5ca4)
(cherry picked from commit 978a093b2357b5c7af29e248987ce61f0656358a)

parser [1].

Change-Id: Ie497b191b6de8bc818dc4a2a12f7129a02d0fd00
